title: Matchsafe, "Socket and Screw Top", ca. 1850
markings: Unidentified mark due to poor impression, possibly a truncated "Appentier", below which is "Portsmouth", both stamped in circle on side of box.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Turned, dark wood, in columnar form, with top that comes to a point, terminating with small, protruding, ivory socket that holds match; turned upper portion of box unscrews to reveal match container; small round of sandpaper adhered to bottom for striker. Round base slightly wider so that box may stand upright on table top.

exhibitions.title: Faster, Cheaper, Newer, More: The Revolutions of 1848

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Socket and Screw Top", ca. 1850.
ca. 1850. Wood, ivory, sandpaper. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-568.
